III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A reported "2-3 days ago" a worker at the facility asked
Youth A if he wanted a piece of candy. Youth A reported he did,
and he began to feel high a few hours after eating it. Youth A
reported on multiple occasions he has witnessed staff bring
edibles and vapes in for other youth in the facility.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/1/2024 and 8/8/2024. She reported Youth A was released home
on 7/30/24 and was lodged in Pod D while at the facility. She was
unaware of the allegations and reported there are always two staff
on the Pod of 10 youth with a ratio of 1:5. She reported there is a
Security Safety Coordinator that watches over the Pod along with
a Facility Manager who is watching the Pod on video at all times.
A Security Safety Coordinator is available to respond to any
situation that might arise. Administrator reported youth are subject
to drug screens prior to home passes and upon returning from the
home pass. She reported every person entering the building is
searched (empty pockets and search bags) and no cell phones
are allowed in the building. If staff have food for personal use, they
are to take the food to the staff lounge and not to share with youth.
Staff are not allowed to eat personal food in front of the youth nor
give the youth any food that is not provided by the facility. The
only exception is teachers are allowed to use food for motivation
and accomplishments in school. Administrator reported Ex-Staff
was terminated a week and a half ago for “workplace violence”.
Ex-Staff was going after a youth who threw something on her and
was placed in the staff office by other staff. Once in the office Ex-
Staff broke a phone on the wall and was terminated. Administrator
reported Ex-Staff did not have the temperament to work at the
facility.
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, Youth F, Youth H and Youth I
were interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/1/2024,
separately. They all reported feeling safe at the facility and never
2

witnessing staff or youth using drugs or a vape. They reported
staff are always appropriate and supervise the youth.
Youth E was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/1/2024. Youth E reported not feeling safe at the facility but was
unable to provide examples and stated, “I feel unsafe in general”.
He reported witnessing Ex-Staff vaping while in the staff office a
week or two prior. Ex-Staff pulled out the vape and used it but no
one else witnessed this action. He reported staff are always
present and supervise the youth on the Pod.
Youth G was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/1/2024. He refused to speak during the interview and did not
want to share any information.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/1/2024
and 8/8/2024. He reported staff should not share things with youth
and if wanting to give a youth candy, then the staff should go
through their supervisor for permission. He has never witnessed
staff or youth using a vape or drugs. He reported understanding
Youth A had consequences when bringing a vape from home after
a home pass. He described Youth A as soft spoken while keeping
distance from other youth. He reported knowing Ex-Staff was
terminated because she got upset with a youth who threw soap on
her and broke a phone in the staff office after being removed from
the Pod. He denied ever hearing that Youth A received any
edibles from staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/1/2024.
She reported never witnessing youth or staff using a vape or
drugs and heard Youth A came back from a home pass with a
vape.
Case Manager was interviewed via phone on 8/5/2024. She
reported Youth A has a history of having issues with marijuana
and wants to have Youth A drug tested but has yet to get this
action established. Since Youth A’s release, he has been living
with Grandmother and Case Manager provided the address and
phone number. She reported Youth A informed of the allegations
on 7/31/2024.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 8/8/2024.
She denied every witnessing staff give a youth anything and
understands that youth are not allowed anything that the facility
does not provide. She denied staff use vapes when working and
3

has never witnessed this action by staff. She was unaware of any
reports of staff vaping.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/8/2024. He reported being the supervisor for Ex-Staff and
reported Ex-Staff was working Pod D just prior to her termination.
He denied hearing of Ex-Staff vaping while working. He reported
there is a zero tolerance for staff giving items to youth and the
only way youth get candy is if earning a level. Every need or want
of the youth that is appropriate must be provided by the facility
and not the staff.
Youth A was interviewed via phone on 8/9/2024. He reported
staff offered him a candy and after eating it he felt “high”. He
reported not knowing who the staff was and that there were no
witnesses to the incident. Youth A reported witnessing staff
(unable to identify) giving vapes to other youth in the program. He
was unable to provide any further details.
Grandmother was interviewed via phone on 8/9/2024. She
reported Youth A is struggling to communicate because he was
overmedicated by the Psychiatrist at the facility. She reported
Youth A was taking “1,000mg” of the following drugs. Trazadone,
Adderall RX, Seroquel, Prozac, and Abilify. She reported talking
with the Case Manager and being told that the medication was
provided by the psychiatrist and Grandmother believed Youth A
liked all of the medication because he liked to be high.
Ex-Staff was interviewed via phone on 8/13/2024. She reported
not being aware of any staff bringing in vapes to the facility. She
reported not being aware of any staff providing edibles to youth at
the facility. She denied ever using a vape at work and described
the process of entering the facility involving a metal detector and
wand on all individuals entering the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
Video Review dated 7/28/24 of Pod D. A review of this video
indicated no passing of anything from any staff on the video to
Youth A. Youth A spent almost the entire video in his room.
Unusual Incident Report Summary date of incident 6/24/2024.
This document indicates the purpose of the incident report is for
Possession of Contraband by Youth A. Youth A was documented
as being found with a vape on his person during a search of Pod
D. The contraband was confiscated, and administration alerted.
4

Youth A was given the consequence of a level drop and the
suspension of home passes.
Youth A list of medications provided to Youth A during his
stay at the facility without a date. The medications are listed.
• Adderall XR 30 MG 8:00 am
• Admphet/Dextr 20 MG 1:30 pm
• Aripiprazole 15 MG 8:00 am
• Clindamycin Sol 1% Daily
• Famotidine 20 MG 8:00 am
• Fluoxetine 20 MG 8:00 am
• Fluoxetine 40 MG 8:00 am
• Quetiapine 200MG 8:00 pm
• Quetiapine 400 MG x 2 8:00 pm
• Trazodone 100 MG x 3 8:00 pm
Psychiatric Evaluation Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services
for Youth A dated 9/22/23. This document outlines the
Psychiatric evaluation provided to Youth A. Youth A was received
at the facility from another Juvenile Justice Center taking
Trazodone 100 mg and Zoloft 100 mg for the treatment of anxiety.
Youth A also reported a long history of ADHD, explosive temper
outbursts, and conduct issues. At the time of this evaluation,
Youth A was presenting with sleep onset and duration difficulties,
impulsivity, irritability, and intolerance of small stressors. He
reported not receiving any treatment for his ADHD and that he
responded well to Adderall XR in the past. Youth A reported a
long history of marijuana use beginning at age 8 and reaching
daily use when available and also used alcohol when available.
This evaluation resulted in a recommendation of Zoloft 100 mg
and Prozac 40 mg for generalized and social anxiety features.
Trazodone abilities from a range of 50 mg to 300 mg and if 300
mg is ineffective, they facility will seek mother’s permission to
begin Seroquel for sleep and anxiety support. Adderall XR 25 mg
will begin in the morning with 15 mg at 2:00 pm. Youth A should
be seen within 4 weeks to reassess the efficacy of use and
possible emergence of side-effects.
Psychiatric Case Notes dated 7/24/24 for Youth A. This
document addresses Youth A’s planned discharge for
7/30/24. Youth A is documented as being in a good mood, calm,
alert, oriented, and cooperative. Youth A has stopped taking the
Trazodone recently and does not want to continue with the Prozac
and Abilify upon discharge. It is documented that Seroquel will be
decreased from 1,000mg (200mg & 400mg 2x) per day to 800mg
5

(400mg 2x) at discharge. It is recommended that Youth A follow
up with Psychiatrist once home.
Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Part 4 Professional
Boundaries: Employee Relationships with Youth dated
2/1/2022. This document outlines some examples of
unprofessional boundaries as buying and/or giving gifts to Youth
that are unauthorized or outside the scope of the program,
accepting gifts from Youth, not serving as an appropriate role
model, and encouraging Youth to engage in illegal or illicit
behaviors.
Program Components without a date. This document outlines
contraband by youth. Possession of contraband is prohibited.
Contraband is described as any unauthorized items in a youth’s
possession or in the youth’s room. Contraband is also described
as any item out of its designated area or any item that is
prohibited to the youth by program rules or treatment staff.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as during staff and youth
interviews, no information supported Youth A was provided
edibles. Youth A disclosed this occurred but was unable to
provide the identify the staff, or when this occurred to further
investigate. Additionally, all staff and other youth denied staff used
a vape. The two youth indicating a staff used a vape could not
provide any further details.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
